rose.name: Rose
rose.size: The diameter ranges from 5 to 9 cm, the height from 5 to 15 cm.
rose.origin: Grows in Europe, Asia, North Africa & North America.
rose.funfact1: For hundreds of years the rose has been widely recognized as a symbol of love, sympathy or sorrow.
rose.funfact2: The rose can come in all colors although a black rose is not actually black, it is usually a dark red.
rose.funfact3: One of the oldest fossils of roses discovered in Colorado dates back from 35 million years ago.

sunflower.name: Sunflower
sunflower.ancientNameMeaning: Helios is Greek for sun, and anthos is Greek for flower
sunflower.size: The diameter ranges from 10 to 30 centimeters, the height from 1 to 3 meters.
sunflower.funfact1: Europe and Rusland produce over 60% of the world's sunflowers.
sunflower.funfact2: Sunflower is the national flower of Russia.
sunflower.funfact3: According to the 1996 Guiness Book of Records, the tallest Sunflower ever grown measured 7.7 meters.

daisy.name: Common Daisy
daisy.ancientNameMeaning: Bellis is Latin for pretty and perennis is Latin for everlasting
daisy.size: The diameter ranges from 2 to 3 cm, the height from 2 to 10 cm.
daisy.origin: Grows in Europe, Asia, North Africa & North America.
daisy.funfact1: Daisy leaves are edible and are high in Vitamin C.
daisy.funfact2: A daisy is actually two flowers in one.

forget-me-not.name: Forget-me-not
forget-me-not.size: The diameter ranges from 1 to 5 cm, the height from 15 to 60 cm.
forget-me-not.origin: Grows in Western Eurasia, New Zealand, Americas & Europe.
forget-me-not.bloom: Blossoms in June, July, August & September.
forget-me-not.funfact1: Forget-me-not is a symbol of faithfulness, true love and remembrance.
forget-me-not.funfact2: Forget-me-nots are seen in rocky mountainous areas, woods, humid fields with altitudes of 700-2800m.
forget-me-not.funfact3: Forget-me-not is the Alaska State Flower.
